docs.abstract: Barbara Altman Bruno letter on August 3 article on treating childhood obesity (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: I wish to add a couple of comments to your very good article, ''Treating Childhood Obesity With Care''$(Aug. 3$). While encouraging youngsters to listen to their body signals of hunger and satiety, furnishing them with nutritious food, and encouraging them to enjoy physical activity are all wise ways to treat them, it is useful to realize that some youngsters may remain fat, regardless.

headline.main: H.M.O.'s Move to Restrict Use of Diet Pills by Members

docs.abstract: Many large health maintenance organizations are placing new curbs on doctors' use of controversial weight-loss drugs fen-phen (fenfluramine and phentermine) and Redux (dexfenfluramine) and are declining to reimburse patients who obtain prescriptions for drugs through commercial weight-loss centers or other means; cite potentially fatal side effects (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Many large health maintenance organizations are placing new restrictions on doctors' use of the controversial weight-loss drugs fen-phen and Redux and are declining to reimburse patients who obtain prescriptions for the medications through commercial weight-loss centers or by other means. The new limits are a response by the managed care companies to the increasing concerns and publicity about potentially fatal side effects of the diet pills. Some of the largest H.M.O.'s in the country are reconsidering their policies regarding these drugs, with some taking more aggressive steps than others.
